Happy Saturday!
.
Just about to jump in the shower and wash these locks! Since I get so many questions about my extensions, I thought I’d create a highlight on my profile & also try my best to answer any questions here on this post, if you have any!
I honestly thought I’d have them for a month or so, realise how much effort they were & how much time they added to my mornings, hate the fact I couldn’t brush my head properly & have them removed. I was so wrong. They’ve cut down the amount of time I spend on my hair because they only really require styling once, and the waves stay put (unlike my real hair that usually resembles a bird nest when I wake up) so some days I wake up and simply brush them & I’m good to go. I’ve also found curling & styling them a lot easier than my shorter hair. You’d think short hair meant less time, but I always found it harder to make it look right because there was less length to play around with!
I also feel like it’s given me a little confidence boost too, I’m certainly not saying that getting extensions has changed my life in some drastic way, as they haven’t, but my god it’s made my mornings so much easier & I have that little bit of added pep in my step because of how much I love them & how they look! 🧡 If something makes you feel good about yourself, bloomin’ well do it!

Struggling with energy & motivation since the evenings got darker. I LOVE this time of year, but it’s such a double edged sword with the darkness that creeps in so much earlier. Seasonal Affective Disorder affects so many people this time of year, so if you’re feeling the same, just know you aren’t the only one. It always takes me a bit of time to adjust & I try to force myself to make evening plans so I don’t just fall asleep on the sofa at 7pm haha! If SAD affects you this time of year, how do you combat it? I think it would be super useful to leave suggestions below for others too! 🙌🏼
.
.

Ad | #DWmoments

For this post, @danielwellington asked me which moments were important and meaningful to me and it was so much fun to capture this.
For me, it’s…
THAT MOMENT of pure joy and bursting happiness because you’re spending the day doing all the things you love, with the people you love at your absolute favourite time of the year! It’s certainly no surprise to a lot of you, that Autumn is my favourite. With the changing leaves, pumpkins a plenty and everything feeling so fresh and cosy both inside and out. I wanted to share some of my special moments at this time of year that always make me feel so grateful, content and full of sheer joy! Largely down to being outside, but spending quality time with people doing ALL the cosy activities. Some of my favourite memories are those captured during these months of the year!

I’d love to know what some of your favourite moments are that you really treasure! Share your moments using the hashtag: #DWmoments & here in the comments!

To see more #DWmoments, you can head to https://www.danielwellington.com/uk/moments/

Today is #WorldMentalHealthDay & this year they’re focusing on suicide prevention. Every year, around 800,000 people die by suicide globally. Men accounted for three- quarters of the 6,507 UK deaths in 2018. THIS IS SO UNBELIEVABLY SAD. Each of us can help by paying close attention to the wellbeing of those around us, open up a conversation and offer up time, understanding and a listening ear for those that might need it.
.
Mental health is something so extremely close to my heart and something I will never stop talking about in the hopes it will encourage others to do the same. For people to feel they can share their stories, their feelings & their thoughts, no matter how awful & haunting they may seem or feel. Trying to navigate your mind is like being lost in a labyrinth, your path can feel back to front, upside down & never ending. You might open a door that takes you somewhere you didn’t want to go or follow a path that leads you further away, but you should never feel alone on your journey. It’s better to have perspective, a difference of opinion, an alternative mind to listen to, and that’s why talking helps! Whether that is to a friend, a colleague, someone you feel you can trust or a therapist, it’s SO important that someone knows how you’re feeling, that someone can offer you a hand when you most need it, or follow you side by side when you get a bit stuck. It might feel as though nobody will understand, that you’re different & that your situation won’t make sense to anyone, but I can PROMISE you, people care, people will listen & people want to help in any way they can 🧡.
.
I decided to accompany this post with a couple of photos of me where I know I felt genuinely SO happy, that even though I’ve had days where I’ve wished my smile was real, it goes to show that these days do exist, and they do happen, and they’re bloody marvellous x

So this is very exciting! Introducing Zoella X @Bagandbones 💗 over the past year myself & the team have designed two very special lights with the @bagandbones team (they make the most incredible LED Neons) It’s been so fun working on a creative project unlike anything I’ve ever done before & I’m so thrilled with them! The first is a showstopping ‘Wouldn’t it be nice’ piece inspired by the classic Beach Boys song about youthful love which is one of my favourite songs! It always pulls me out of a funk & makes me smile! (You can pre order this in a choice of 4 colours, I have the white here in my bedroom) 100% of the profits from the sale of this light will be donated to @Mindcharity. The second light is a super fun pair of boobs to serve as a reminder to check them regularly! These also come with the choice of 3 different style nipple stickers (hearts, stars or crosses) 100% of the profits from the sale of this light will be donated to @coppafeelpeople. I really hope you love them as much as we all do, and these two charities mean a lot to me and the team, so we’re delighted to be raising funds for them both! The link to shop is in my bio 🙌🏼 .
.
